feed.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [ERI1C][Managed vSphere] - Storage maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 6, 07:30 - 22:00 UTC

Oct 3, 20:15 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed vSphere offer in ERI1C region.

Start time : 06/11/2025 07:30 UTC
End time : 06/11/2025 22:00 UTC
Service impact : There will be no impact on the vSphere UI, data availability, or virtual machines during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling out an update for multiple storage servers.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [EU/CA][Hosted Private Cloud] - vSphere maintenance notification
entry.content:
Oct 10, 16:07 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Oct 6, 07:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Oct 2, 20:15 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed vSphere offer.

Start time : 06/10/2025 07:00 UTC
End time : 10/10/2025 16:00 UTC
Service impact : vSphere will not be accessible and the hosts will be put into maintenance mode during the operation.
If the host has virtual machines in it, a vMotion will be performed.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on our Managed vSphere offer.
An individual communication will be done to inform customers.
Customers can reschedule the operation through the manager.

Thank you for your understanding

entry.title: [RBX8][Managed vSphere] - Racks R802R19 - R802R20 - R802R21 incident notification
entry.content:
Oct 7, 15:56 UTC
Resolved - We are pleased to inform you that the incident affecting our Managed vSphere has been resolved.

Start time : 07/10/2025 07:30 UTC
End time : 07/10/2025 14:00 UTC
Root Cause : The incident is cause by this maintenance: https://network.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/3z9046m4y93d

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Oct 7, 11:05 UTC
Update - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : Hosts in racks R802R19 and R802R21 are now operational.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Oct 7, 09:06 UTC
Update - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : Some hosts in rack R802R20 are temporarily unavailable.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Oct 7, 08:25 UTC
Identified - We are currently experiencing an ongoing incident. We have determined the origin of the issue affecting our Managed vSphere offer on the racks R802R19 - R802R21 , in the region RXB2C.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 07/10/2025 07:30 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Some hosts are temporarily unavailable.
Customers Impact : Customers are temporarily unable to access their hosts in the specified racks.
Root Cause : The incident is cause by this maintenance: https://network.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/3z9046m4y93d
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding

entry.title: [RBX8][Managed vSphere] - Cluster9301/Cluster9303 incident notification
entry.content:
Oct 6, 09:16 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that we had an incident on Cluster9301 and Cluster9303 in RBX8.
This incident has now been resolved.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 06/10/2025 08:29 UTC
End time : 06/10/2025 08:43 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Storage Cluster9301 and Cluster9303 were temporarily unavailable.
Customers Impact : Customers were temporarily unable to access their datastores located in the specified clusters.
Root Cause : The incident was caused by this maintenance :https://network.status-ovhcloud.com//incidents/kc300dpcx11h

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.

Thank you for your understanding.

Sep 22, 07:00 UTC

Sep 10, 22:03 UTC

Start time : 22/09/2025 07:00 UTC
End time : 25/09/2025 16:00 UTC

An individual communication will be done to inform customers.
Customers can reschedule the operation through the manager.

entry.title: [RBX8][Managed vSphere] - Rack R803L14 incident notification
entry.content:
Sep 18, 13:56 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that the incident on our Managed vSphere offering has now been resolved.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 18/09/2025 10:26 UTC
End time : 18/09/2025 12:22 UTC
Root Cause : This incident was caused by an electrical equipment issue.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.

Sep 18, 12:22 UTC
Monitoring - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : All hosts in rack R803L14 are available again.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are currently monitoring the situation.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Sep 18, 10:50 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating an incident affecting our Managed vSphere offering, which is causing temporary availability issue in the rack R803L14.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 18/09/2025 10:26 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : All hosts located in the rack R803L14 are temporarily unavailable.
Customers Impact : Customers are temporarily unable to access and use their hosts located in the specified rack.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.
